alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 10:21AM EST until January 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin and northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Gonzalez, Molino, Jay, Chumuckla, New York, Brickton, Barth, Pine Barren, Brownsdale, Molino Crossroads, Quintette, Cobbtown, Cottage Hill, Cantonment, Mount Carmel, Berrydale, Pine Forest, Fidelis, Beulah and Dixonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
